headline: Winnie Odinga Takes on William Ruto for Saying Raila is Stingy: "Give with Your Heart"

headline: Mike Sonko Advises Jobseekers Against Lying In CVs: "Just Be Honest"
author: Kai Eli
description: Former Nairobi governor has noted that most of resumés sent by job seekers bear inaccurate information about them. He urged them to be honest as they try out.
articleBody:
Former Nairobi governor Mike Sonko has wondered why Kenyan job seekers have to lie in the resumés whenever they apply for job openings.

Sonko noted that most of the documents bear inaccurate information about the applicants.

He suggested that out of the lying, the jobseekers end up not succeeding in their applications even after attending the interviews.

"Those applying for Jobs check your CV again delete those lies you have put therein. Be honest remember God knows that truth and He sees you lying so that you get the job. God will open your employment door," he wrote.

headline: Gathoni Wamuchomba Tables Law to Allow Gov't to Rehire Retired Medics, Police Officers and Teachers
author: Didacus Malowa
description: Kiambu woman representative Gathoni Wamuchomba has tabled a bill that seeks to have the government rehire retired employees in education,security and health.
articleBody:
Kiambu Woman Representative Gathoni Wamuchomba has tabled the Geriatric Bill, 2021 that allows the government to rehire pensioners
The bill will allow the government to hire retired civil servants to the critical sectors such as health, national security and education
The bill will introduce the National Council for Older Members of Society to take care of the welfare of the elderly

Kiambu Woman Representative Gathoni Wamuchomba has tabled a bill in parliament that will see the government rehire pensioners in the health, security and education sectors.

The Geriatric Bill, 2021 will provide the Cabinet secretary powers to make voluntary and non-voluntary post-retirement employment to older members of the society.

The senior citizens will get to work on scaled hours in the three critical government service areas given their advanced age.

“The Cabinet secretary shall in consultation with the council, the Public Service Commission, independent commissions, state agencies and the Salaries and Remuneration Commission, make regulations for voluntary or non-voluntary post-retirement employment of older members of society, on scaled hours, in the following critical service areas,” reads the bill in part.

Education and health sectors have been constantly affected by industrial actions for years, and recently county administrations recalled retired medics to keep operations running.

Older members of the society

The bill, which is yet to be introduced in parliament, seeks to introduce the formation of the National Council for Older Members of Society.

The new council would be charged with taking care of the elderly in the society by providing care, protection and empowerment of older people.

“The Bill seeks to improve the living conditions of older members of society by providing for their rights to human dignity, safety and security, education, health and equality and non-discrimination,” reads the bill.

Wamuchomba boycotts TV Interview

In a separate incident, the outspoken woman representative skipped on a tv interview where she was to debate with Sports Chief Administrative Secretary (CAS) Zack Kinuthia.

Wamuchomba asked Kinuthia to resign from his plum position after the court declared it unconstitutional.

headline: COVID-19: 3 Cases of Omicron Variant Detected in Kenya, CS Kagwe Confirms
author: Racheal Nyaguthie
description: Kenya has recorded its first case of the Omicron variant of COVID-19, Health Cabinet Secretary Mutaho Kagwe has said. It was discovered among new travellers.
articleBody:
Health Cabinet Secretary Mutahi Kagwe confirmed the detection of three cases of Omicron variant in Kenya
The new cases, which are the first to be recorded in the country were found among new travellers at the airport
Kagwe, who made this announcement today, Wednesday, December 15, said the people with the new strain have been taken into quarantine

Kenya has recorded its first case of the Omicron variant of COVID-19, Health Cabinet Secretary Mutaho Kagwe has said.

The new strain that has been sending shockwaves in various parts of the world where it has been detected was tested among travellers at the airport in Kenya

Kagwe confirmed the detection of the variant on Wednesday, December 15, saying three people who were found with the variant had been put on quarantine.

"We have detected the Omicron variant particularly among travellers [at] the airports and so it's just a matter of time before it becomes dominant worldwide," he noted

Kagwe, who was addressing the council of governors, said the variant spreads very faster further calling for caution from members of the public.

While dismissing reports on locking down the country, the vocal CS urged governors to instead prepare isolation facilities because more variants are more likely to emerge in the future.

"Our experts are still debating the issue, observing and sequencing in our labs to see what kind of variant we have. Variants will come and go," he said.

headline: Bernice Kariuki: Meet Kenyan Working as First-Team Chef for EPL Giants Arsenal
author: Rene Otinga
description: While many staunch Arsenal fans relish the chance of meeting some of their idols one day, Bernice Kariuki has the rare priviledge of preparing their meals.
articleBody:
Bernice Kariuki grew up in Jericho, Eastlands in Nairobi
She, however, worked her way up and currently has a role as a private chef at Arsenal football club
She has a background in the hospitality industry and has worked for high-end hotels in the UK

It is not every day you get to hear a tale of a humble Kenya from Jericho emerging as one of the top chefs in one of the biggest football clubs in the world.

But this is exactly the case with Bernice Kariuki, an ambitious Kenyan who works as a first-team chef at London club Arsenal.

Yes, you read that right. While many staunch Arsenal fans relish the chance of meeting some of their idols one day, Bernice has the rare priviledge of preparing their meals.

So how did it come to be? Well, her story is that of sheer passion, determination, and perhaps a slice of luck.

Bernice was born and raised in Jericho, Eastlands in Nairobi but somehow worked her way up and ended up studying Culinary Arts at Westminster Kingsway College in London.

Her passion for culinary arts led her to land jobs at 5-star hotels in England as a Chef, with big names like The Lanesborough, The Dorchester and The Waldorf Hilton London among those in her portfolio.

But perhaps her biggest source of pride at the moment is working as a private chef for Arsenal’s first team, a role she landed at the time the Gunners were confirming Mikel Arteta’s appointment.

Working under the leadership of Darren Taylor, the Executive Chef at Arsenal, her roles include cooking for first team players and members of the technical bench and management team.

A quick tour of her Instagram will reveal that indeed she is a master at what she does as she has photos of some exquisite-looking meals which speaks volumes about her work.

Bernice recently spoke at a forum for Kenyans in the U.K in Windsor, Berkshire on Monday, November 29 where she urged Kenyans in the diaspora to relentlessly chase their dreams without too many excuses.

“When I win we all win…we all have challenges. It’s not easy, we need to push because we are in a better country where you can become who you want. Don’t say kuna racism (there’s racism). No, no, no – you can become who you want,” she said.

At the forum, she also ran into Manoah Esipisu, and the Kenyan High Commissioner to the UK could not contain his excitement.

"Delighted to bump into Arsenal first-team chef Bernice Kariuki at a black-tie Kenya UK Diaspora event in Windsor, Berkshire. Trailblazing and embodying the Kenyan 'can do' spirit. Congratulations," the diplomat shared on his social media.

headline: 19-Year-Old Law Student Wins First Case After Successfully Suing His Landlord: "It Was Easy"
author: William Osoro
description: Jack Simms, a law student in England, sued his landlord for misrepresentation after a luxury hostel advertised online turned out to be a construction site.
articleBody:
Jack Simms, a 19-year-old student, saw photos of a luxury student hostel online and decided to move in
However, he realised the actual building was not as good as advertised, and it was undergoing construction
The law student moved out, and after referring to his textbooks, he sued his landlord for misrepresentation and won

A law student has won his first case at just 19 years of age.

BBC reports that the university student named Jack Simms took his landlord to court and got a favourable ruling by consulting his textbooks.

False advertising

Simms decided to take action after renting a hostel after seeing pictures, but which turned out to be the exact opposite.

Simms, a student at the University of East Anglia in England, said he did not get a chance to view the hostel before moving in physically.

"I thought I was going to get what I'd seen on these photos- These nice, upmarket student accommodation rooms," he said.

However, he got a rude shock when he turned up.

According to Simms, the purported luxury hostel was instead a construction site.

"There were workers everywhere hammering the ceiling and walls. The place was covered in dust from sanding," he said.

Going to court

After staying at the hostel for a week, he decided to move out and stopped paying rent. The landlord threatened to send debt collectors after him, but Simms turned to his textbooks to build a case.

A judge ordered the landlord to refund Simms his rent money and court fees totalling KSh 149,000.

"It was quite easy to be honest. You just can't let these landlords win," he said while encouraging young people to stand up for themselves.

Father sues teacher

Jimmy Hoffmeyer filed a lawsuit of KSh 110 million against the said class teacher.

Hoffmeyer argued that his daughter's constitutional right was violated, and the child suffered racial discrimination.

description: Georgina Rodriguez took boyfriend Cristiano Ronaldo's children on a magical £1,500-a-night Lapland cabin trip to see Santa as they enjoy the festive season.

headline: Newspapers Review: Kiraitu Murungi Says Mt Kenya Region Will Not Get Presidency for Next 20 Years
author: Racheal Nyaguthie
description: In the newspapers today: Meru Governor Kiraitu Murungi has asked the Mt Kenya region to prepare to stay without the presidency for the next 10 or 20 years.
articleBody:
On Wednesday, December 15, the national dailies reported on the launching of new political parties in Western and Mt Kenya regions as the race to succeed President Uhuru Kenyatta hots up.

Pay attention:

The papers also reported on ODM leader Raila Odinga's presidential bid which seems to have received a major boost following the formation of the Azimio la Umoja Movement.

1. Taifa Leo

According to this publication, Meru Governor Kiraitu Murungi has told the Mt Kenya region to prepare to stay without the presidency for the next 10 or 20 years.

Murungi, who was speaking during the launching of a new political party identified as the Devolution Empowerment Party, which was popularly referred to us Bus, said the region needs to have strong parties which will take care of its resources.

The county boss said the Mt Kenya region should now put its focus on having strong political parties that will champion its needs in the national government for the period that it will be out of power.

He also said that the decision to revive bus was premised on the manner in which the ruling Jubilee Party has sidelined many Mt Kenya politicians.

2. Daily Nation

According to this newspaper, Mombasa Governor Hassan Joho half-brother Mohammed Amir has castigated his former party ODM for failing to keep many of its promises to coastal residents.

The governor's senior brother who recently defected to William Ruto's United Democratic Alliance (UDA) said both the ruling Jubilee Party and ODM failed to improve the economic fortunes of the region.

Amir also said he was facing animosity for his decision to join UDA but reiterated he is ready to pay the price because he is a true servant of the people.

He urged his brother Joho to consider ditching ODM for the deputy president's party in order to keep his political career alive.

3. The Standard

The newspaper reports on a former Egerton University female student's murder case at a Nakuru court.

Eunice Njeri, who was a fourth-year student pursuing a degree in Clothing, Textile, and Interior Design was found dead on December 6, 2020.

The prime suspect in the murder is Eric Maingi, who is believed to have strangled her to death.

During the murder trial on Tuesday, December 14, the deceased's mother said her daughter declined to go home to see her and a day later, she was found dead.

4. The Star

According to this paper, ODM leader Raila Odinga's presidential bid received a major boost after a new political party by a section of western Kenya leaders threw its weight behind his quest.

Eugene Wamalwa is now targeting Trans Nzoia and Bungoma residents as its stronghold.

The new outfit named Kanduyi MP Wafula Wamunyinyi as the party leader while his Tongaren counterpart Eseli Simiyu was named as the secretary-general.

This came months after the two MPs fell out with Ford Kenya's Moses Wetang'ula.

5. People Daily

According to the People Daily, former Kiambu governor Ferdinand Waititu now wants the High Court to remove the incumbent county boss James Nyoro from office.

Waititu

This came just a day after the impeached county exuded confidence that he will clinch Kiambu's top seat in the 2022 polls.

headline: Newly Graduated GSU Officer Goes Missing after Pass Out Ceremony, Family Worried
author: Asher Omondi
description: A newly graduated General Service Unit officer, Mohamed Nur Daudi, has been reported missing by his family five days after the passout on Wednesday, December 8.
articleBody:
Mohammed Nur Daud was among hundreds of the new GSU officers who graduated on Wednesday, December 8
However, the family said Daud did not reach their Barsheba home, Mombasa county, five days after he graduated
The 23-year-old had informed them that he was visiting his aunt in Nairobi's Eastleigh after graduation

A distraught Mombasa family is in pain after their kin went missing five days ago upon leaving the General Service Unit (GSU) college in Embakasi, Nairobi.

Mohammed Nur Daudi was among hundreds of the new GSU officers who graduated on Wednesday, December 8.

However, the family while speaking to Citizen TV on Tuesday, December 14, said Daud did not reach their Barsheba home, Mombasa county.

Visiting aunt

According to them, the 23-year-old had informed them that he was visiting his aunt in Nairobi's Eastleigh after graduation before he could board a matatu to Mombasa later on.

"I had talked to him that day, he told me he was going to Eastleigh. In the evening, I asked his aunt if he had reached Eastleigh but she said she had not seen him. That was the last time we spoke. His phone is off," his father.

Details at the GSU college indicated Daud left the institution like other graduates on Thursday, December 9.

Deployment halted

Elsewhere, the National Police Service halted the deployment of GSU graduates who were captured on camera, threatening to harshly deal with the civilians after their passing-out parade.

As part of the investigations into the incident, the officers were retained at the Embakasi police campus as the rest of their colleagues were posted to their respective stations.

Police spokesperson Bruno Shioso said they would seek to establish the number of GSU graduates who psyched themselves up before taking disciplinary action.

“Of course we understand these are young officers who are full of excitement for their first day of service. It was a big day also in terms of the chief guest present but there must be a review of what happened. We can’t make assumptions, ” said Shioso.

headline: New Twist as Gov't Finds Another KSh 108m in Bank Account of Felesta Njoroge's Friend
author: Racheal Nyaguthie
description: The Asset Recovery Agency (ARA) has successfully obtained orders freezing two bank accounts belonging to Tebby Wambuko Kagu a friend of the 21year old student.
articleBody:
The plot surrounding the Belgian man who gifted his Kenyan lover KSh 102 million has thickened after the government discovered he also sent millions to another woman
Kago, only identified as a businesswoman and who is also Felesta's friend received KSh 102.8 million from Merc De Mesel
The self-employed businesswoman also received another KSh 37 million in November 2021 from Mesel

The mystery surrounding the Belgian national who gifted his 21-year-old Kenyan lover KSh 102 million has deepened after the government also discovered that he sent more than KSh 100 million to another woman.

The wealthy Belgian national Merc De Mesel grabbed headlines a few weeks ago after it emerged that he had sent his lover Felesta Njoroge KSh 102 million as a gift.

On Tuesday, December 14, the Asset Recovery Agency also pulled the curtains back on bank accounts belonging to Tebby Wambuku Kago, which also received millions from the same foreigner.

The anti-corruption court heard that on August 10, 2021, Kago, only identified as a businesswoman and who is also Felesta's friend received KSh 102.8 million from Merc De Mesel.

Kago, in a bid to cover her tracks, is said to have withdrawn KSh 31.5 million between September and October this year.

After the withdrawal, the self-employed businesswoman also received another KSh 37 million in November 2021.

The missing amount is reported to have been distributed to friends and relatives of the woman, to conceal her action from the Central Bank of Kenya.

"Preliminary investigations have established that the respondents executed a complex scheme of money laundering designed to conceal, disguise the nature, source, disposition and movement of the illicit funds, suspected to constitute proceeds of crime and which are the subject matter of this application," ARA lawyer Mohammed Adow told Justice Esther Maina.

Investigating officer Fredrick Musyoki noted that Kago opened her bank account in February 2021 as a self-employed businesswoman, but raised eyebrows after the account, received the humongous amount.

Freezing of accounts

In her ruling, Justice Ester Marina ordered the freezing of a further KSh 5 million in Felesta's Stanbic bank account.

Additionally, the ARA will also hold Kago's Equity Bank accounts, which have a total sum KSh 108.2 million.

The court gave the directive after ARA, through its lawyer Mohammed Adow said Kago and Felesta are suspected to be part of a syndicate involved in a complex money-laundering scheme involving themselves and foreign nationals.

"That in the month of August 2021, the Agency received information into a suspected case of money laundering schemes, and proceeds of crime involving multiple money transactions conducting through the bank accounts of the Respondents in USA Dollars and Kenya Shillings mainly from foreign jurisdiction whose source has no legitimate explanation involving the Respondents herein and other foreign Nationals," he said in Court papers.

Adow told the court that their investigations revealed how the two young women went to great lengths to conceal money laundering activities by executing a complex movement, source and nature of the funds suspected to be proceeds of crime.

The court was also told that authorities received intelligence information that there were two women involved in money laundering schemes, where they received money from foreign jurisdictions while they could not substantiate the legitimacy of the source.

"That preservation orders are hereby issued prohibiting the respondents (Wambuku and Nyamathira) and or their representatives, employees, agents, servants or any other persons acting on their behalf from transacting, withdrawing, transferring, dealing in any manner whatsoever in respect to the funds and any profits or benefits derived or accrued from held in the three bank account," the court-ordered.

Felesta, who was the first victim of ARA, had her account containing KSh 102.5 million frozen for 90 days, to give the agency adequate time to trace and establish the source of the funds.

headline: Veteran Journalist Louis Otieno's Son, Husband Celebrate 2nd Wedding Anniversary
author: William Osoro
description: Silas Miami, the son of veteran journalist Louis Otieno celebrated his husband as they marked their 2nd wedding anniversary. Miami said Patrick makes him happy.
articleBody:
Veteran journalist Louis Otieno’s son Silas Miami heaped praise on his mzungu husband Patrick on their anniversary
Miami said Patrick makes him happy, adding that the two years together had just whizzed by
Miami, who has a Master's degree in Arts, announced marrying Patrick in 2020 while divulging that they were in a polyamorous relationship

Silas Miami, the son of veteran Kenyan journalist Louis Otieno, has celebrated his husband Patrick on their anniversary.

Two years together

Based in Amsterdam, Netherlands, Miami took to social media on Saturday, December 11, to shower her husband with love, saying they were marking two years since tying the knot.

He shared a photo laughing heartily at the camera as his bearded, mzungu husband could be seen in the background.

Miami further asserted that he was jealous and would

ld not share Patrick with anyone.

“He makes me laugh like this every single day. Yes, even on the worst ones. No. we can't share. We got married two years ago today.

I need time to slow down,” he wrote.

Miami later shared another post of Patrick's romantic act as they celebrated their anniversary. His husband decided to give him 24 white roses and a single red rose for the next month.

Social media users reacted to Miami and Patrick's anniversary by stating:

@leelee.love13:

“This makes my heart happy for you! Congratulations love.”

@missnerima:

“Happy anniversary to you, Silas, and your personal person. May the belly deep, face contorting laughter continue!”

“Happy anniversary, to many more.”

@truthslinger:

“Happy anniversary y’all.”

@anyikowoko:

“Love is...”

@shi_mungai:

“Oh a very happy anniversary to you both!”

Miami confirmed he was gay in 2020 while revealing that he had married Patrick.

"I met and married someone just under a year ago. He's got all the things: kindness, courage, honesty but, while this is all fine and great, that's not why I married him. Neither of us believed in marriage. We still do not.

But after months of us looking at the options for what companionship could look like, especially seeing as travel is not exactly easy for us, we settled on going for it. We maintain an ethically polyamorous situation because monogamy gives us both migraines," Miami wrote.

headline: List of Most Expensive Nursery Schools in Kenya, Their Owners and Fees
author: Japhet Ruto
description: Banda School, located along Magadi Road in Karen, Nairobi tops the list of the most expensive nurseries in Kenya where parents pay up to KSh 3.3m per term.
articleBody:
Wealthy Kenyans and expatriates, most of whom reside in the capital, are known to take their children to international schools to get the best quality education
Nursery schools are where kids get the necessary help to lay a foundation before they join primary school
Banda School, located along Magadi Road in the leafy Karen suburbs, tops the list of the most expensive nurseries in Kenya where parents pay up to KSh 3.3 million per term

Kenya is home to some of the most expensive schools in the region.

Wealthy Kenyans and expatriates, most of whom reside in the capital, are known to take their children to international schools to get the best quality education.

Nursery schools also referred to as early childhood education centres (ECDs) are where kids get the necessary help to lay a foundation before they join primary school.

Which are the most expensive nursery schools in Kenya?

1. Banda School

Located along Magadi Road in the leafy Karen suburbs, Banda School offers the British education system.

According to its September 2021 to August 2022 fees structure seen by TUKO.co.ke, those kids in nursery 1 (two to three years) pay KSh 225,000 for five days. Parents of pupils in nursery 2 (three to four years) part with KSh 250,000 and reception (four to five years) pay KSh 280,000 for the same period.

This means that for a month, a parent for a pupil in reception will pay KSh 1.1 million which adds to KSh 3.3 million per term.

The fees are inclusive of lunch and snacks.

Its chairman is D.G.M. Hutchison.

2. German School

The school which was established in 1969 has been providing children and young people in Nairobi with German school education.

It also offers music, library, PE, and swimming lessons.

The average fee is KSh 2.4 million.

The school is chaired by von Maltzan, Katharina who also doubles up as the head of marketing, communication and sports.

3. Braeburn Garden Estate

Braeburn Garden Estate is a British Curriculum institution that offers international education to students from over 80 nationalities aged two to eighteen.

Braeburn Garden Estate was founded by Terry Childs and is run under the Braeburn Group of International Schools.

Annual fees

Crèche - morning only - KSh 604,800 plus a deposit of KSh 50,000.

FS1 (nursery - morning only) - KSh 695,700, deposit KSh 50,000.

FS1 (afternoon care only for crèche & nursery) - KSh 79,200.

FS2 (reception) - KSh 774,000, deposit KSh 50,000.

4. Brookhouse International School

The international school was established in 1981 by the Puxley family as a small British style preparatory school in Karen, Nairobi.

It is a member of the premium schools group operating in Europe, Asia-Pacific, Africa, the Middle East and Latin America.

Annual fees

Stage 1 - KSh 300,000.

Pre-school stage 2 - KSh 780,000.

Pre-school stage 3 - KSh 810,000.

Reception - KSh 890,000.

5. Nairobi International School

The NIS, located off Muthangari Road, in Lavington, is one of the most expensive schools in Kenya.

It offers the British and Wales curriculum.

Fees per year

Playgroup - KSh 459,000.

Kindergarten 1 - KSh 507,000.

Kindergarten 2 - KSh 520,500.

The admission fees are KSh 25,000 per head.

Most expensive schools

Kenya has a total of 90,145 schools, according to the 2021 Economic Survey released by the Kenya National Bureau of Statistics.

In 2019, the number of private primary schools increased by 1.5% to 9,191, while the number of public primary schools declined to 23,246 from 23,286.

The International School of Kenya tops the list of the most expensive schools in Kenya, with parents paying up to KSh 3.4 million in fees.

headline: Anne Kananu Denies She Was Snubbed During Jamhuri Day Celebrations: "I Was Hospitalised"
author: Racheal Nyaguthie
description: Governor Anne Kananu explained why was missing in the state house luncheon that was held after the Jamhuri Day celebrations. She said she went to take a rest.
articleBody:
Governor Anne Kananu explained why was missing in the state house luncheon that was held after the Jamhuri Day celebrations
She said she had been hospitalised all week and she, therefore, went to rest after the fete

Nairobi Governor Anne Kananu has denied she was ignored during the Jamhuri Day celebrations where she was denied a chance to speak during the fete and did not also attend the party at state house.

She further clarified that she enjoys a cordial working relationship with President Uhuru Kenyatta.

"I had been hospitalised this past week and in adherence to my doctor's recommendation, I took a rest after Jamhuri Day celebrations hence my absence at state house," she said.

headline: Babu Owino Offers to Buy Apartment for DJ Evolve's Family after Charges Withdrawn
author: Asher Omondi
description: As one of the conditions for the withdrawal of murder charges against Embakasi East MP Babu Owino, the legislator offered to purchase a house for DJ Evolve.
articleBody:
Felix Orinda alias DJ Evolve made an application seeking to withdraw his case against Embakasi East lawmaker Babu Owino
Principal magistrate Bernard Ochoi allowed the withdrawal noting that both Babu and DJ Evolve were friends
The Milimani Law Courts heard that the house purchase was one of the conditions for the withdrawal of the case

Embakasi East MP Babu Owino has agreed to purchase an apartment for the family of Felix Orinda popularly known as DJ Evolve.

The Milimani Law Courts on Tuesday, December 15, heard that the house purchase was one of the conditions for the withdrawal of DJ Evolve's attempted murder charges against the lawmaker.

Babu told the court that the purchase would ensure the DJ Evolve does struggle to pay rent given that he is currently not gainfully employed and still recuperating at home.

Senior Principal Magistrate Bernard Ochoi said the ODM lawmaker will also pay the medical bills and expenses of the victim who was the principal witness.

“ As a condition of withdrawal, the MP will purchase an apartment for the victim, which will resolve the issue of house rent, and continue paying the hospital bills of the victim who comes from a humble background,” said Ochoi.

DJ Evolve's application

The outspoken lawmaker was charged after allegedly shooting the city entertainer at Nairobi's B Club on January 16, 2020, which left him bedridden.

The deejay, being a principal witness, applied to withdraw the case citing his long friendship with Babu which they have kept even after the incident.

“ I have come to the conclusion that this is a matter [in which] a court should encourage reconciliation as envisaged in the Constitution and, therefore, I will allow the request to withdraw the charges against the accused in count one – attempted murder. He is acquitted,” Ochoi ruled.

However, the legislator is not yet off the hook despite the ruling. The court said Babu will be prosecuted for behaving disorderly while carrying a firearm.

Out of court settlement

In a submission by State Counsel Evelynn Onunga, the court was made aware that the parties were having deliberations aimed at having the matter arbitrated away from the courts of law.

The court heard that the prosecution held two meetings between Babu and the entertainer together with their lawyers.

headline: 30-Year-Old Woman Who Got 180 Marks in KCPE, Worked as Housegirl Now a Landlady
author: Hillary Lisimba
description: Mary Wanjiku Gachie scored 180 marks in her KCPE exams but managed to turn her life around and is now the proud owner of prime houses in Nairobi's Runda estate.
articleBody:
Mary Wanjiku Gachie's future looked bleak in 2006 after she scored 180 marks in her KCPE exams
She turned her life around after secondary school and not only got employed but also rose to the level of a manager
Wanjiku left the corporate world and got into real estate, now she boasts of owning a prime housing project in Runda

In 2006, Mary Wanjiku Gachie sat her Kenya Certificate of Primary Education (KCPE) exams at Ikinu Model Primary School in Kiambu and scored a paltry 180 marks.

Her future looked dead and buried in the eyes of many people, but it was a setback that would serve as a testimony for the future.

String of setbacks

Speaking to TUKO.co.ke 's Hillary Lisimba, Wanjiku revealed that she was forced to become a house girl since her mother was unable to get a secondary school for her.

Her education dreams seemed to get back on track after one of her aunts offered to pay her fees.

"In April, that is four months after joining secondary school, my mum passed on," she expressed.

Even in the midst of all the challenges, Wanjiku managed to complete secondary school and, this time too did not perform well.

Promoted from secretary to manager

After her Kenya Certificate of Secondary Education (KCSE), she took a few short courses in computer, French, and driving.

In 2013, she secured a job as a secretary at Africoff Trading and managed to rise through the ranks to the level of a manager.

"They gave me a promotion after learning that I had mastered the tactics of the company to the level of being an expert," she said.

As fate would have it, Wanjiku's rise to the top came with more good tidings as she met the love of her life who would soon become her husband.

Turning point

After deciding to get married, they pooled resources together and started a housing project in Runda that culminated in several houses both for rent and sale.

"In June of 2020, I resigned and became a director of our investment company where I now channel my mind and energy into making the project a success," she concluded.

At the moment, Wanjiku looks back at her past in awe, unable to believe that she rose from a hopeless place to a landlady in one of Nairobi's prime suburbs.

headline: Viral Mzungu Hawker to Close Her Hotel in Kisumu: "I'll Be Cooking from The House"
author: William Osoro
description: Sylvia Bichanga, a mzungu who went viral for hawking American snacks in Kisumu, announced plans to close her shop. However, she will still be hawking in town.
articleBody:
Sylvia Bichanga, an American famed for hawking snacks in Kisumu, plans on closing her shop
The lady, married to Kevin, a Kenyan, said she decided to close shop after her business partner left
However, Sylvia will still be hawking American snacks in town as she plans on moving the business to her house

Sylvia Bichanga, a mzungu who went viral for hawking American snacks in Kisumu, is set to close her shop.

Via a video shared on Facebook on Tuesday, December 14, Sylvia said she would no longer sell snacks from the outlet known as Mzungu Pretzels.

“I just want to say that there are some changes about to come. I plan on closing Mzungu Pretzels and I will be cooking from my house,” she said.

Business partner’s exit

Sylvia, married to Kenyan Kevin, said she decided to close the shop after a partner who helped her start the business left.

The lady, who first came to Kenya with her family as a missionary, recruited Kevin to help run the shop when her business partner left.

“My husband did a great job but said he did not enjoy it as it was not his thing. He got the opportunity to be a taxi driver,” she said.

Left to run the shop by herself, Sylvia weighed the options available.

“I wondered what I would do with my business and decided to move everything to my house,” she said.

However, according to Sylvia, she will still be hawking snacks within Kisumu.

“I will put my phone number and if you want to order from somewhere in town you can do that. Thank you for all your love and support,” she said.

Sylvia, who grew up in Ohio, told Tuko.co.ke that she had no plans of getting married when she moved to Kenya.

One day, robbers raided their house in Kisumu and carted away their electronics. She accompanied her father to an electronics shop where Kevin worked, and that is how they met.

“I could not believe my eyes when I saw him. My spirit left my body. My hands were trembling, I had never seen such a handsome man in my life. That is where I went down a difficult road,” she said.

They got married in April 2021.

headline: Diaspora Story: High Costs of Death Abroad, Benefits of Taking Insurance
author: Japhet Ruto
description: When a loved one dies in another country, it’s not only expensive but also requires immediate and significant financial resources to cover a host of costs.
articleBody:
When Martin Kapami left his home in Lusaka, Zambia, for the United Kingdom, he set his sights on the opportunities ahead.

All was going well until he lost a family friend in the UK, whose body needed to be repatriated back to Zambia for burial. The family did not have the £6,000 (KSh 902,000) needed by the company that does body repatriation.

His friend had not taken insurance to cover expenses like these. They had to create a GoFundMe account to raise the money needed. It was a nightmare for him and the family. The wife ended up borrowing money from the bank to meet the costs.

Diaspora Insurance

Years later, during a church service at one of the local churches, Kapami came across Diaspora Insurance company’s stand, and he took an interest in what they had to offer.

“I wasn’t serious. I just wanted to find out what they could do. So I talked to a gentleman there and asked him what he was doing there, which countries they service," Kapami said in an interview.

The gentleman advised Kapami that Diaspora Insurance provided a funeral policy that paid cash upon the death of a loved one. They targeted Africans in the diasporas and paid up to £20 (KSh 3,000).

One of the things that Kapami was impressed by were the low premiums that the company offered.

“The premiums were quite low, something like 20 pounds per individual,” he recalled.

Kapami shared with his wife, Bessie Kapami, about the insurance cover. After reviewing it together, they agreed it was more affordable than the 200 pounds (KSh 30,000) they’d been paying for insurance with a different firm.

“I thought it was reasonable at that particular time, and it’s more affordable looking at the actual costs involved,” Kapami noted. Not only was it cheap, but it offered many appealing features like the fact that you could add people back in Zambia on the same policy, something which the UK insurers could not do. Moreover, Kapami and his family would remain covered even if they relocated to Zambia later on.

Right from the beginning, Kapami and his wife had started preparing to go back to Zambia.

“We thought we should start preparing for our retirement so we came here and started doing all our projects with the intention that one day or the other, we’ll be old so we should come back to Zambia,” he added.

Little did Kapami know that he would soon need the same insurance cover.

In March 2021, Kapami lost his beloved late wife, Bessie, who took the Diaspora Insurance cover.

“We were both covered even when we traveled for the burial of our friend during the COVID-19 era from about March 2020 till now,” he recalled.

When the time came for Kapami to organise his wife’s funeral, he wasn’t sure where all the funds would come from, but he knew he had to get things going.

He needed to bring his late wife’s body to Zambia to honour her wishes to return home to Zambia.

Repatriation costs

So, he and three other people began the process of repatriating Bessie’s body back to Zambia. They had to foot several costs, including travel and hotel accommodation.

“Looking at that cost alone, it’s very high. Plus, the airline we always use had canceled all flights to the UK, so we weren’t sure how we were going to travel back with the high costs,” he quipped.

The costs of repatriation plus travelling with the three family members proved a huge cost for Kapami.

He was desperate for a miracle.

Two days after his wife died, Kapami got in touch with Diaspora Insurance and shared with them what had happened and what he was going through.

The insurance company swung into action and deposited money into Kapami’s account to cater to funeral expenses.

“I got in touch I think after two days, and the fourth day, they had transferred the money to my account. They looked at my premium payments and saw that everything was up to date, and that was all they needed from me,” Kapami said delightfully.

Diaspora Insurance had helped relieve Kapami’s heavy load at the time when he needed them the most.

“They did everything and then called me to check my account and confirm if the money had been deposited was there,” he added.

The insurance company had come through for Kapami. They paid for repatriation and everything else he had needed for to give his late wife a befitting sendoff.

The cost of death in the diaspora

When a loved one dies in another country, it’s not only expensive but also requires immediate and significant financial resources to cover a host of costs.

Among those costs include:

Prolonged funeral vigils abroad and back home.
Body repatriation.
Family travel to or from the diaspora.
Burial costs (coffin/casket, food, church service, photography/videography, flowers and décor, memorial services, household bills, shipment of the deceased’s personal effects).
Local transfers or transportation.
Cost of burial, whether abroad or back home.
Household bills like electricity.
Memorial service and/or Tombstone ceremony

All these and other related costs have untold suffering on the deceased’s next of kin and relatives. There’s the trauma of mourning their loved one with empty pockets to emotional scars, no closure, loss of personal/family dignity, undignified send-off, post-funeral bills, no peace of mind or protection of loved ones, and more.

Of all these costs, body repatriation takes a huge chunk. That’s because there are several costs attached to it, including administration, flights, body preparation, and even getting a casket to ship the body from the foreign country and back home.

Such costs could easily top a whopping USD 15,000 or £5,000 if you’re repatriating from the US or UK, respectively, which translates to about KSh 765,000 to 1.5 million, or more.

For most African families, it’s hard to raise such staggering amounts, so they end up borrowing from a bank or enduring the embarrassment and double trauma of begging from strangers on GoFundMe and other platforms. The repatriation process is also complex, and it differs depending on each country. Read more on the Diaspora Insurance website.

Diaspora Insurance provides Africans living in the diaspora with their flagship product – The Diaspora Funeral Cash Plan (DFCP), a product born out of personal tragedies and experiences.

With the DFCP plan, bereaved families are assured of giving their deceased kin a befitting send-off bereft of the embarrassment of begging from strangers to foot the bill.

Specifically, the DFCP offers benefits such as:

Immediate cash pay-out.
Worldwide protection without borders: Once you are on the policy, you remain covered wherever you are, even if you relocate back home.
Cover for you and your loved ones wherever they are: most insurers don’t cover out of territory risk.
Uniquely flexible: you get burial abroad, body repatriation or cremation, and much more. Your family can choose what they want to do, for instance, repatriate their loved one to the country of birth or to lay them to rest in the host country.
To learn more about the key features and benefits of the DFCP, please go to Diaspora Funeral Cash Plan.

The versatility of a cash-based funeral cash plan was amply demonstrated when the late Pamela Tawengwa sadly passed away whilst on visit in her native country, Zimbabwe, and the family opted to honour her wishes to be buried in the UK, her newly adopted country.

headline: Kenyan Woman Gifts Her Househelp Loads of Cash, Phones and Handbag: "Thank You"
author: Racheal Nyaguthie
description: The Kenyan woman identified as Effie Keens Kaano from Kisumu county thought it wise to reward her domestic help of two years as she goes home for Christmas.
articleBody:
A kind Kenyan woman left her housegirl with a smile on her face after gifting her money, phones and a bag
The Kisumu woman said she appreciated her nanny identified as Nancy with the presents because she did not want her to go home for Christmas empty-handed
The employer had displayed the gifts on a chart that was decorated with a beautiful thank you message for the nanny

A Kisumu woman has warmed many hearts after gifting her house girl several goodies as appreciation for work well done in 2021.

The woman identified as Effie Keens Kaano thought it wise to reward her domestic help of two years as she breaks for the holidays.

Speaking to TUKO.co.ke the mother of one said she gifted her house girl cash, a smartphone and another feature phone for her mum along with a handbag so that she would not go home for Christmas empty-handed.

"She is just an employee like any other person. Like taking good care of my daughter every day is not an easy job plus the house and I thought because she is going home, a little token is everything," she told this writer.

Her nanny, identified as Nancy could not hide her joy as she received the gifts from her which were beautifully displayed on a chart that had a lovely message.

"Dear Nancy, thank you for taking good care of Herra in 2021. You are a blessing to us and we love you. From Mama Herra," the heartwarming message read.

The cash displayed on the chart amounted to KSh 15,000.

"Even people working in big companies get little tokens at the end of the year. It's the little things that count in life," the lovely lady told TUKO.co.ke.

Hardworking Busia woman

In another feel-good story, TUKO.co.ke also recently reported about Eunice Otieng, a Busia woman who defied all odds to build herself a house and rentals four years after her husband left her.

Being the strong woman she is, Otieng, who works as a nurse said she decided to pick up the pieces and rebuild her life from scratch.

The hardworking Busia woman said she gifted her five-year-old daughter the rentals to heal the pain they went through when the landlord closed their house due to rent arrears.

headline: Kitale Lady Who Failed to Join University 14 Years after High School Lands Another Sponsorship
author: Jackson Otukho
description: Milly Nafula, who recently hit headlines after it emerged she did not join university even after scoring an A- in 2007 KCSE has landed another sponsorship deal.
articleBody:
Milly Nafula wrote her KCSE in 2007, scoring a mean grade of A- but 14 years later, she was yet to get admission to any university
After her story went viral, Mount Kenya University offered her a full scholarship to study medicine
Henry Thairu, the vice-chancellor of the Presbyterian University of East Africa, pledged to support Nafula's two children and her brother

A 32-year-old lady who recently hit headlines after it emerged she did not join university even after posting remarkable results has landed another sponsorship deal.

Milly Nafula sat her Kenya Certificate of Secondary Education (KCSE) in 2007, scoring a mean grade of A- but 14 years later, she was yet to enrol at the university.

In an interview with various media outlets, Nafula said she had hope of becoming a doctor but her dreams were crushed when she failed to receive an admission letter.

MKU scholarship

After her story went viral, Mount Kenya University offered her a full scholarship to study medicine.

Speaking during the 20th edition of MKU graduation in Thika, the institution's founder, Professor Simon Gicharu, said he was touched by Nafula's plight.

Gicharu stated that the scholarship will be instrumental in her journey to becoming a medical doctor.

The grant will cover tuition fees for Nafula's Bachelor's programme in medicine and surgery.

Just a day after being awarded the MKU scholarship, Henry Thairu, the vice-chancellor of the Presbyterian University of East Africa

Thairu, the former Chairman of the Commission for University Education (CUE), said he will donate KSh 10,000 yearly towards the education of the three.

Nafula's 17-year-old brother, Tony Masinde, is in Form Three at Njoro Secondary School.

Her two children, Henry aged 5 schools at Amani Primary School while her 3-year-old lastborn, Ismael, is yet to commence formal education.

Losing her mother and sister

While following up on the university admission, Nafula's mother who was their sole provider passed away in 2012 and in 2013 her elder sister also died, leaving her and her two siblings.

A desperate Nafula reached out to her uncle in Nairobi for help who then advised her to travel to Nairobi where she was to work as an M-Pesa agent.

Unfortunately, four months after being employed, she lost KSh 25,000 and the owner of the shop demanded she pays back the money.

Nafula was forced to work for two years in order to pay back the amount she had lost and she would only receive KSh 1000 as salary for her personal use.

She later quit the job after her brother joined Form One because she could no longer manage to pay his school fees.

She found another job at a hotel where she worked overtime and she would often fall sick due to the long working hours.

Getting pregnant and being abandoned

While at it, she became pregnant and the man who impregnated her promised to help her only for him to disappear after she gave birth to her child.

After a while, he came back claiming to have secured a job and that he would now help her, which led to Nafula getting pregnant with her second child and the man disappeared once again.

headline: Nakuru Woman Fulfilled after Building 3 Bedroom House for Mum Who Lived in Mud-Walled Hut: "Trust The Process"
author: Jackson Otukho
description: Kenyan woman, Tabs Nims, together with her siblings built a luxurious three-bedroom house for their elderly mother who was initially living in a mud-walled hut.
articleBody:
A Kenyan woman, Tabs Nims together with her siblings built a luxurious three-bedroom house for their elderly mother
Taking to Facebook, Nims shared photos of the new house they had constructed and the mud-walled grass-thatched hut in which they initially lived
The lady said they resolved to build another bigger house as their dear mother was ageing and needed a nice bathroom, not a latrine

Nothing beats the feeling of gifting your parents especially if you grew up with literally nothing.

This was the case of a Kenyan woman, Tabs Nims, who, together with her siblings built a luxurious three-bedroom house for their elderly mother.

Taking to Facebook on Sunday, December 12, Nims shared photos of the new magnificent house they had constructed and the mud-walled grass-thatched hut in which they initially lived.

"When they say from grass to grace it means exactly what you see in the pictures below. Yes, that hut used to be our only home. I and my siblings grew up in that house," she wrote.

When she turned six years, the lady said her parents were blessed to build a two-bedroom mud house but this time with iron sheets. She said they turned their small hut into a kitchen.

Ten years ago, she said they were able to remodel the two-bedroom mud house to a semi-permanent one.

Three bedroom house

Coming from a large family, Nims said she and her brother, Njosh Njenga, decided that the two-bedroom house was no longer enough to accommodate them.

Also, she said they resolved to build another bigger house as their sweet mother was ageing and needed a nice bathroom, not a latrine.

The house has three bedrooms, a spacious kitchen, living room and dining room, two bathrooms, storage/pantry room, a laundry room and a car garage.

"I thank God because he has faithfully walked with us step by step, our hut many years ago is not in existence. It has been a journey but our God who said will fulfil all our Heart desires has done it," said Nims.

Michelle Boit who is in her early 40s took to social media to celebrate her parents for their upbringing.

The engineer who studied in the United States said she was motivated to build her parents a four-bedroom house after observing most of her friend's parents were suffering as their children live large in the foreign nation.

headline: Concern as FKFPL clubs yet to receive money from Caretaker committee
author: Rene Otinga
description: The caretaker committee tasked with steering Kenyan football has broken its silence amid a growing suspicion over the vow to grant financial support to clubs.
articleBody:
The caretaker committee tasked with steering Kenyan football has broken its silence amid a growing suspicion over the promise to grant financial support to clubs.

The committee had promised KSh 300,000 and KSh 250,000 to clubs in the top tier and the NSL respectively.

But more than two weeks after the grants promise was made by the Aaron Ringera-led body, clubs are yet to receive the financial support.

At the start of December, the caretaker committee released the following statement:

“We received your requests for funding from FKF Caretaker Committee to help with some logistics of resumption of league fixtures. We note, however, that because of the limited resources available at this moment in time, for a start the FKF Caretaker Committee has agreed that it will provide Sh300,000 for each of the Premier League Clubs and Sh250,000 for each of the National Super League football clubs,"

Two weeks on and while clubs are yet to receive any funds, the committee took to quell any tension that may have arisen from their promise.

In a presser held on Tuesday, December 14, Anthony Isayi, the caretaker treasurer said the delays were simply down to some logistical challenges.

“We are working on logistics currently. We are in the process of opening a bank account which of course requires a lot of clearance both from the Ministry and the Treasury. As soon as the logistical part is completed, we will be able to wire money to clubs to support them with the logistics as soon as possible. As it stands, they have not received the money,” Isavi said.

The task ahead for caretaker committee

Weeks into the new tenure, the 15-man caretaker committee seems to have its work cut out.

headline: Ruthless Man City Thrash Leeds United to Go 4 Points Clear at The Top
author: Rene Otinga
description: An attacking masterclass from Man City saw them tear apart Leeds United in a 7-0 rout at the Etihad on Tuesday, December 14, with De Bruyne getting a brace.
articleBody:
An attacking masterclass from Manchester City saw them tear apart Leeds United in a 7-0 rout at the Etihad on Tuesday, December 14.

City were at their scintillating best, and had Kevin De Bruyne to thank as the Belgian was in frightening form throughout the night.

The scoreline would have been much more embarrassing for Marcelo Bielsa’s men if City managed to convert all their chances, but credit still has to be given to the home side for their attacking display.

Phil Foden opened the scoring after eight minutes with a strike after Rodri’s initial effort was saved.

That goal also bore some personal significance for Pep Guardiola’s Man City career as the Spaniard became the fastest City boss to see his side score 500 goals during his tenure. It only took 207 matches.

The second goal came five minutes later, with Riyad Mahrez curling in a brilliant cross which Jack Grealish nodded in with relative ease for a rare headed goal.

De Bruyne, who was recently reintegrated back into the squad, got in on the act with a decent shot from Rodri’s pass for his first goal since October.

Barely moments after the second half kicked off and it was 4-0 as Mahrez found the back of the net with a low shot that took a cruel deflection off Junior Firpo and De Bruyne sealed his brace with perhaps the best goal of the night - a mighty shot from outside the box that flew into the top corner.

Defenders also got in on the act as John Stones made it six with a header and Nathan Ake rounded off the scoring with a header from Phil Foden’s corner.

The result took City four points clear once again, and the ball goes to Liverpool and Chelsea’s courts as the two chasing sides try to close down the lead once again.

For City, however, the biggest plus on the night will be their goal difference, which is now closer to free-scoring Liverpool’s.

headline: Brazilian Politicians Decide to Settle Differences in Three-Round MMA battle
author: Rene Otinga
description: Simão Peixoto, the mayor of Borba, was challenged to a three-round bout in September by one Erineu da Silva - a former councillor. The fight happened on Sunday.
articleBody:
Two feuding politicians in Brazil decided to settle their scores in the ring in a fight
The fight involved Simão Peixoto, the mayor of Borba and a former counsellor called Erineu da Silva.
It all started when Silva released a video online criticizing the mayor
Peixoto, in a rejoinder, challenged the former counsellor to a fight that went on to take place in the wee hours of Sunday, December 12

Sometimes, the best way to end a bitter feud is to square it up inside the ring, literally.

This was the case with two Amazonian politicians, who decided to settle their scores through an entertaining boxing match.

Simão Peixoto, the mayor of Borba, was publicly challenged to a fistfight back in September by one Erineu da Silva - a former counsellor.

It all sparked off when Silva, popularly known as Mirico, openly criticized the mayor for his alleged failure to conserve a waterpark near the Madeira river.

Silva went on to demand a fistfight with the mayor, whom he termed as a “rotter” and “crook”.

Interestingly enough, Peixoto actually accepted the challenge, releasing a video online confirming that he was ready to take on his antagonist.

In the video, the mayor can be heard yelling, “Show your face!”

The three-round bout was held on Sunday, December 12, in the town’s sports centre, with a crowd of hundreds cheering the two on.

It is kind to note that Peixoto is an ardent MMA fan and is used to appearing on ads wearing gloves.

On the day of the bout, he entered the ring full of confidence, stamping on the mat while making intimidating gestures towards his rival.

Once the bout was underway, the two men wasted no time jumping onto each other, with Silva managing to take down the 39-year old mayor twice.

In a bizarre twist, however, the judges declared Peixoto the winner, and the two seemed to have squashed their beef at the end as they shared an awkward embrace.

Amid some criticism over his conduct, the mayor later said that the bout was meant to promote sports.

headline: 4 Arsenal Players Mikel Arteta Is Considering to Replace Aubameyang as Captain
author: Fred Kennedy
description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has reportedly drawn up a four-man shortlist of players he is considering for the captaincy role after he ditched striker Aubameyang.
articleBody:
Arsenal are currently without a captain after they ditched Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang
Aubameyang was axed as the club's captain due to a 'disciplinary breach' that also saw him dropped for the Southampton match
Alexander Lacazette is believed to have been included on Arteta's list of potential players who can succeed Auba

Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has reportedly drawn up a four-man shortlist of players he is considering for the captaincy role.

The Gunners are currently without a skipper after Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang was stripped of the role.

Aubameyang was axed from the responsibility on Tuesday, December 14, when Arsenal confirmed he will no longer sport the club's armband for a 'disciplinary breach.'

The decision was reached just days after the Gabonese striker was dropped from the team that played Southampton at the weekend.

Metro UK now reports speculation is already rife on who Arteta could name as Aubameyang's replacement.

According to talkSPORT, there are four names currently being considered, with the pair of Alexander Lacazette and Kieran Tierney the frontrunners.

Goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale is also said to be in the frame alongside Granit Xhaka who was axed from the role back in 2019.

But according to former Arsenal star Martin Keown, Tierney would have been a better option for the position had he been playing regularly.

As such, Arteta has to look elsewhere from the squad for Auba's replacement.

"I don’t know the group well enough as men but the one I’m looking at as a leader is Ramsdale. He’s a crowd favourite, he wears his heart on his sleeve, but he’s a goalkeeper. I’d rather it be someone in the engine room," Keown said.

"Arteta must have a clear vision of who that captain is going to be," he added.

headline: Man United Star Fitted with Heart Monitor After Chest Pains While in Action vs Norwich
author: Fred Kennedy
description: Man United centre-back Victor Lindelof has had a heart monitor fitted on him after he suffered chest pains while in action against Norwich City on Saturday.
articleBody:
Victor Lindelof had to be replaced midway through Man United's EPL clash against Norwich City
The Swede dropped down in discomfort with what appeared to be difficulties in breathing
His wife has since revealed the United defender is doing much better pending further tests

Man United centre-back Victor Lindelof has had a heart monitor fitted on him after he suffered chest pains while in action against Norwich City.

Lindelof had to be withdrawn from the weekend match after he dropped down in discomfort with his hand on his chest.

United medics rushed onto the pitch to provide medical care for the Swede as they helped him leave the pitch.

And just days after the scary moment, the defender's wife, Maja Nilsson Lindelof, has divulged the footie star is now having his heart monitored.

However, she was quick to reveal Lindelof "seems to be okay" and will be undergoing further tests in the coming days.

"He did a lot of tests and has a heart monitor on for two days to make sure everything is OK," she posted on her blog.

"Everything seems to be okay as luck would have it and we are waiting for answers to the last tests that will end tomorrow," she added.

Eriksen memories

While reflecting on Lindelof's incident, David de Gea said it sparked memories of Christian Eriksen during the Euro 2020.

At the time, the former Tottenham midfielder collapsed after a cardiac arrest before he was resuscitated on the pitch and rushed to hospital.

“We saw some players who are feeling a bit of problems with their breathing. We saw Eriksen and Aguero," De Gea noted.

“It is difficult to see your players acting like this and I hope he is fine," he added.

Aguero suffers heart problem

Meanwhile, former Man City star Sergio Aguero is the other high-profile footballer to suffer a heart problem in recent weeks.

Aguero, who moved to Barcelona in the summer is understood to have suffered chest pains while playing against Alaves before he was rushed to hospital.

headline: Premier League Title Prediction Made as Man City, Liverpool and Chelsea Go Neck-To-Neck
author: Fred Kennedy
description: Former England goalkeeper David James has rated Chelsea as the team to beat in the Premier League title race. The Blues are currently placed third on the log.
articleBody:
The 2021/22 Premier League season is proving to be a three-horse race pitting Man City, Liverpool, and Chelsea
The three teams have been in scintillating form this term, with City currently topping the standings
Chelsea have faltered in recent days, dropping points against rivals Man United at home and away to West Ham
However, ex-keeper David James still believes the Blues have all it takes to be crowned champions at the end of the season

Former England goalkeeper David James has rated Chelsea as the team to beat in the Premier League title race.

The Blues have been in scintillating shape this season, winning nine of their first 12 league matches to emerge as early pacesetters in the Premier League.

However, the west Londoners dropped points at home to Man United at the end of November and suffered a 3-2 loss last weekend against West Ham to fall behind their title rivals.

Thomas Tuchel's charges looked set to drop points against Leeds United on Saturday, December 11, only for Jorginho to net a stoppage-time penalty to hand his side a crucial win.

Chelsea are now placed third on the log with 36 points, two behind leaders Man City and just one behind Liverpool who are placed second.

And despite faltering in the title challenge, ex-goalkeeper James contends the Stamford Bridge dwellers are the team to beat ahead of Liverpool and City.

"I’m glad Chelsea won today because they are the team to beat for me," he told Stadium Astro.

"It’s a tough season but I think Chelsea are the team to beat. When you see Liverpool in this kind of determined form, stringing wins together, of course, they are going to run them close," he added.

EPL standings after match-week 16

Earlier, TUKO.co.ke reported the top three slots of the Premier League standings remain unchanged after all teams winning their respective fixtures.

Man City are still topping the standings with 38 points after their crucial win over Wolves, with only two points separating them and third-placed Chelsea.

West Ham were the biggest losers from match week 16 following their draw at Burnley and are now in danger of dropping out of the top four.

headline: Kenyan Comedienne Elated After Boyfriend She Met on Facebook Gifts Her Brand New Lexus Hybrid
author: Prisca Aroko
description: Karimi Ule Mmeru is happy after her boyfriend bought her a Lexus Hybrid. The two met on Facebook and she ignored him for three months before going out with him.
articleBody:
Comedienne Karimi Ule Mmeru is beyond thrilled after her lover of close to two years bought her a new white Lexus Hybrid
The radio presenter told TUKO.co.ke she met her current lover via Facebook when he asked her out for coffee and it took her three months to accept the date proposal
She also added that before the two met officially, he sent her KSh 5000 three times but she never showed up
According to Karimi, her current lover has proved to her that all Meru men are romantic

Comedienne and radio presenter Karimi Ule Mmeru is a happy woman after her boyfriend, whom she met via Facebook, bought her a brand new white Lexus Hybrid.

Karimi's big surprise

In an exclusive interview with TUKO.co.ke, the entertainer narrated that it all started with a message on Facebook of him asking her out for coffee.

She then ignored the guy for three months. He sent her KSh 5000 for fare three times. She used the money and never showed up.

In a screenshot seen by TUKO.co.ke, the gentleman texted Karimi on February 26, 2020, and asked her to go on a coffee date with her.

She responded and asked him where, and he told her in Nairobi West.

"At first I ignored him because I thought he was looking for a slay queen. But I realised his chats and calls were very mature. So I decided to go for a coffee date after the three months after eating fare for that long," she said.

She and her boyfriend who is a prominent person started a relationship and the two are still going strong.

Karimi recently left social media on standby after it emerged that her lover surprised her with a car, something that she said she was not expecting.

When asked what she thinks made the man chase after her, she said:

"He said he used to watch my videos and he believed I will be his wife one day, he thought to himself that I am a wise woman. He has shown me that all Meru men are romantic."

headline: Wahu Lauds Sauti Sol for Hosting Own Festival, Says Music Industry Is Not Dead but Evolving
author: Victor Otengo
description: Singer Wahu believes that the Kenyan music industry is currently developing and there will be a lot of challenges, mistakes and learning to do going forward.
articleBody:
Wahu has praised Sauti Sol for their hard work in music, which has seen them reap the fruits
The singer noted Kenyan music is currently evolving, and all artistes were in the pioneer stage of the urban pop industry
The mother of two added there would be challenges, mistakes and a lot of learning to do that will lead to growth

Singer Wahu has lauded musical band Sauti Sol for their impact in the Kenya music industry.

This comes after the group hosted a successful concert dubbed Sol Fest on Sunday, December 12, attended by hundreds of fans and celebrities.

Wahu shared a photo from the concert on Instagram as she praised the band for proving that Kenyan music is very much alive.

The singer noted the industry was not dead but was only going through evolution through different stages with ups and downs.

"Thank you @sautisol for proving that Kenyan music is very much alive! Let no one cheat you that the industry is dead, it passes different stages with ups and downs and different waves, this is part of industry evolution," she said.

New wave of music

Wahu added that they were all part of the pioneer stage of the urban pop industry, and there was a lot of challenges, mistakes and learning to do.

She added that if the industry can have strategies in place, then artistes will grow faster and become more sustainable.

Raila Odinga excites Wahu

The power couple released the song on October 6, 2021, and it has garnered over 800k views on YouTube.

The veteran politician danced with a group of youth, and his dance moves left many awed.

"Allaaaarrrr! Baba! is that you killing it on the BackitUpChallenge? Sijui tumpatie N-zone hoodie?" Wahu wrote as she lauded the politician.

headline: Where It Started: Dr Ofweneke Makes Return to Vioja Mahakamani
author: Brian Ajon
description: Comedian Dr Ofweneke made a return to the popular KBC's show, Vioja Mahakani. He was once a cast in the courtroom comedy show years ago before taking a break.
articleBody:
Dr Ofweneke made his debut on Vioja Mahakamani over six years ago when the TV comedy show decided to hire new and young faces
After being on the show for some years, the comedian took a break to pursue other activities among them hosting a regular talk show at Ebru TV
On Sunday, December 12, Ofweneke made a return to the show that made him famous

Comedian and actor Sande Bush aka Dr Ofweneke has left his fans excited after returning to Vioja Mahakamani.

The comedian featured on the Madaraka episode of the courtroom-like comedy show.

How it started

Ofweneke made himself famous thanks to the long-running TV show that hitherto airs on Kenya Broadcasting Corporation (KBC).

He oftentimes played a role as an accused person battling petty cases at the court.

Ofweneke returns to Vioja Mahakamani

The funny made a surprise return to the show on Madaraka Day.

In a video shared on KBC's official YouTube channel, Ofweneke appeared in the courtroom accused of taking advantage of his employee.

Vioja Mahakamani first reboot episode

The famous courtroom comedy's first reboot episode was aired on Friday, June 25, with its old casts after a seven-year hiatus.

Its comeback saw the return of veteran actors from the prosecutor Gibson Mbugua to Ondiek Nyuka Kwota (Hiram Muigai) and Makokha, born Mathias Keya.

Vioja Mahakamani was a top national comedy show back in its heyday. It depicts normal court proceedings in a comical and educative way.

TUKO.co.ke, Comedian Terence Creative recently became a trendsetter with his famous Wash Wash skits leaving all and sundry to imitate his way of talking.

headline: Chipukeezy Lauds Eric Omondi, Thanks Comedian for Mentoring Him
author: Brian Ajon
description: NACADA Vice-Chairperson Vincent Muasya Mutua aka Chipukeezy attributed part of his comedy success to comedian Eric Omondi.He said Eric mentored him before fame.
articleBody:
Chipukeezy mentioned comedian Eric Omondi as one of the few people who held his hands before fame and riches
He said the president of comedy Africa took him to his shows so that he could get the opportunity to shine and get a breakthrough

Comedian Vincent Mwasia Mutua popularly known as Chipukeezy has acknowledged Eric Omondi's contribution to his career success.

Chipukeezy went on his Instagram stories on Tuesday, December, to walk his fans down the memory lane, detailing how it began.

He shared a series of throwback photos of himself while he was still struggling to find a footing in the comedy industry.

Chepukizeey thanks Eric

The funnyman described Eric Omondi as a good man who gave him a chance when life was so rough for him.

He noted that Eric would tag him along to his local and international gigs so that he could also get a breakthrough.

"Eric Omondi is a good man, he took me as a brother. When times were tough he advised me. He carried me with him to his shows when the industry was not giving me enough opportunities. He introduced me to the international market by taking me to his international gigs," read part of the post.

Chipukeezy learn English

TUKO.co.ke, the comedian shared that doing a comedy show in the United States made him realise that he had to work on his English mastery so as to reach a broader audience.

Chipukeezy said he has always wanted to be an international comedian and not one bound within the Kenyan borders.

"I did not want to only be a Kenyan comedian, I wanted to be a worldwide comedian. At that point, I realised I had a disability because I could not speak proper English. So after coming from the US, I told myself that I had to learn the language and took time to do that. I would look for people to teach me. Sometimes they would be speech teachers or Arts tutors who train kids,'' he said.

headline: GOtv Expands Network Coverage to Nanyuki, Customers to Access Unmatched Entertainment
author: Japhet Ruto
description: GOtv Customers in Nanyuki, Timau, Naro Moru, Doldol and Thigitu can now access unmatched entertainment available on the GOtv service with clear picture quality.
articleBody:
Customers in Nanyuki, Timau, Naro Moru, Doldol and Thigitu can now access unmatched entertainment available on the GOtv service with clear picture quality
Sales and aftersales support within these regions are available at partner network outlets and service centre outlets where customers can access a full range of services
GOtv currently has 24 sites countrywide, and six new sites, including Nanyuki that will be launched in the coming weeks

On Tuesday, December 14, GOtv announced the launch of a new transmission site in Nanyuki.

Customers in Nanyuki, Timau, Naro Moru, Doldol and Thigitu can now access unmatched entertainment available on the GOtv service with clear picture quality and affordable, world-class entertainment.

Laikipia County Executive Committee (CEC) Member for Trade, Tourism and Cooperatives, Biwott Tirop, while commissioning the site, said:

“The launch of the GOtv site will accord the residents of Nanyuki and neighboring areas an opportunity to plug in to a wider selection of entertainment. The county government also welcomes this move as it will unlock more employment opportunities for residents of this area. We look forward to a continuous partnership with Multi-Choice Kenya as we look to enhance the existing mutual partnership."

Speaking during the launch event Nancy Matimu, MultiChoice Kenya managing director, said:

“It is a proud moment for us as we launch these new sites will offer more Kenyans access to information, education and entertainment available on over 70 channels on the GOtv platform. With the economic effects of the pandemic felt, consumers are increasingly price-conscious and selective in their non-essentials spending.

"The launch of these new sites also plays a key role in supporting the government’s agenda to increase access to credible information and affordable entertainment to Kenyans in all parts of the country.”

GOtv sites

GOtv currently has 24 sites countrywide and six new sites, including Nanyuki that will be launched in the coming weeks. This will take the number of sites across the country to 30, making GOtv the pay-tv provider with the widest coverage network.

GOtv customers in Laikipia county now have access to wholesome family entertainment available on five packages.

GOtv Supa unlocks a world of the finest entertainment and lifestyle channels for the entire family with 70+ entertainment channels.

These include premium local and international channels, namely Maisha Magic Plus, TL Novelas channel, Honey Channel, Food Network, Maisha Magic Poa and Mambo Moto channel.

Others are SuperSport Select 1 and 2 offering games from the Premier League, La Liga, Serie A matches, a 24-hour WWE Channel, National Geographic for wildlife and nature lovers, Akili Kids, Nick Junior Boomerang and Nick Toons for the kids, among other entertainment channels.

GOtv packages

GOtv Supa is GOtv’s top tier package and is available for only KSh 1,499 a month.

GOtv customers in these areas can also subscribe to GOtv Max at KSh 1,150 with 55 local and international channels, GOtv Plus, which offers over 45 channels at KSh 870, GOtv Value available for KSh 550 a month with over 30 channels and GOtv Lite, which is available for only KSh 265 per month with over 20 channels including local favourites Maisha Magic East, Akili Kids and TV 47.

“GOtv remains committed to offering greater choice, more variety and greater value to enrich the lives of Kenyans. As we head into the festive season, we have revamped our packages to offer families an enriching viewing experience with a wide selection of content from across the globe. We welcome our customers in Nanyuki, Bomet, Kilifi, Kitui, Busia and Nyahururu to the GOtv family. Kuwa na Krisi Supa na GOtv,” added Matimu.

GOtv Customers can also purchase the GOtv decoder plus a one-month GOtv Plus subscription for KSh 1299 by simply dialling *423#, or via online platform Jumia, or at any dealer outlet or select supermarkets countrywide. Customers have the option to upgrade to a package that best suits their viewing needs after purchase.

headline: Edwin Sifuna Says He Won't Vie in 2022, Will Concentrate on Making Raila President
author: Jackson Otukho
description: The ODM secretary-general Edwin Sifuna has said he will not be seeking any political seat in 2022, says he will contrate on making Raila Odinga the president.
articleBody:
Edwin Sifuna noted that people were asking him to vie for the Kanduyi parliamentary seat or try again in Nairobi's Senatorial race
However, Sifuna turned down the offer saying he wants to redirect his energy to ensure Opposition leader Raila Odinga wins the presidency in 2022
In 2017, Sifuna unsuccessfully contested for the Nairobi Senatorial seat after being floored by the incumbent Johson Sakaja

Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) secretary-general Edwin Sifuna says he will not be seeking any elective political seat in the 2022 General Election.

In 2017, Sifuna unsuccessfully contested for the Nairobi Senatorial seat after being floored by the incumbent Johson Sakaja.

Prior to moving his political base to Nairobi, he had sought Kanduyi parliamentary seat but lost in ODM primaries to lawyer John Makali who was, in turn, defeated by Ford Kenya's Wafula Wamunyinyi.

Concentrate on Raila Odinga

Speaking in Bungoma on Tuesday, December 14, Sifuna noted that people were asking him to vie for the Kanduyi parliamentary seat or try again in Nairobi's Senatorial race.

However, the vocal politician who doubles up as a lawyer, turned down the offer saying he wants to redirect his energy to ensure Opposition leader Raila Odinga wins the presidency in 2022.

"I'm not going to vie for any elective position in 2022. I know people have been asking to vie for a parliamentary seat in Kanduyi, others wanted me to go for Nairobi senatorial seat.

"But after wide consultations with my people, family and close friends, I have decided to shelve my ambitions and concentrate on supporting Raila Odinga's presidential bid," said Sifuna.

As previously reported, It is now official Raila will make a fifth stab at the elusive presidency in his bid to succeed President Uhuru Kenyatta.

Addressing Azimio la Umoja national convention at Kasarani Stadium on Friday, November 10, Raila said he had listened to calls for a change of leadership during other conventions.

The ODM leader clarified his acceptance to run for the top seat following calls from thousands of Kenyans, was not personal but a commitment borne out of the need for a better country.
