headline: Babu Owino Thanks God after DJ Evolve's Attempted Murder Case Is Withdrawn: "He's Faithful"
author: Kai Eli
description: Embakasi East Babu Owino has attributed his acquittal from an attempted murder case to God. The charges against the MP was dropped on Tuesday, December 14.
articleBody:
Embakasi East MP Babu Owino has thanked God following the withdrawal of the charges he was facing of attempted murder
Babu allegedly shot Felix Orinda, alias DJ Evolve, at Nairobi's B Club on January 16, 2020, leaving the entertainer bedridden
Speaking to TUKO.co.ke, the youthful lawmaker didn't have much to put across regarding the development that has favoured him

Embakasi East MP Babu Owino has broken his silence regarding withdrawal of the DJ Evolve attempted murder case.

The outspoken lawmaker was charged after allegedly shooting the entertainer at Nairobi's B Club on January 16, 2020, leaving him bedridden.

However, in a ruling delivered on Tuesday, December 14, Magistrate Bernard Ochoi accepted an application by the entertainer to withdraw the case.

Babu: It's God's doing

Having no much to say, Babu attributed the withdrawal of the case to God, whom he said has been faithful to him.

"Yes! God is faithful," he stated.

In his ruling, Ochoi noted Babu and Evolve were friends before the incident and maintained the same even after the unfortunate occurrence.

He added that the ODM lawmaker was also taking good care of the DJ.

"Taking all the above into account, I have come to the conclusion that this is a matter where the court should encourage reconciliation as envisaged in the constitution and therefore I will allow the withdraw against the accused in count one. The accused is acquitted," said Ochoi.

The court said Babu will be prosecuted for behaving disorderly while carrying a firearm.

Out of court settlement

On Wednesday, July 21, a Nairobi court heard Babu and Evolve's family had made tremendous steps to have the matter settled out of court.

In a submission by State Counsel Evelynn Onunga, the court was made aware that the parties were having deliberations aimed at having the matter arbitrated away from the courts of law.

The court heard that the prosecution held two meetings between Babu and the entertainer together with their lawyers.

DJ Evolve's mother dies

The entertainer's mother passed away on the evening of Wednesday, September 22. She reportedly got breathless, collapsed, and was rushed to a hospital, where she breathed her last.

The DJ's father, John Orinda, said his 54-year-old wife collapsed at their Lucky Summer home in Nairobi.

She was laid to rest on October 20, 2021.

headline: William Ruto Visits, Condoles with Ken Osinde’s Family: “Rest in Peace”
author: Dennis Lubanga
description: Deputy President William Ruto visited and consoled with the family of his late Chief of Staff Ken Osinde at his Lavington home in Nairobi county on Tuesday.
articleBody:
Deputy President William Ruto visited the late Ken Osinde's family at his Lavington home in Nairobi on Tuesday evening
On Sunday, December 12, Interior Cabinet Secretary Fred Matiang'i joined other leaders in mourning Osinde
Matiang'i expressed sorrow at the untimely death of his friend, whom he noted exhibited no illness or sickness until his passing on

Deputy President William Ruto has condoled with the family of his Chief of Staff Ken Osinde following his demise.

The second in command visited Osinde's family at his Lavington home in Nairobi on Tuesday evening.

"At Lavington in Nairobi county, offered our prayers and words of comfort to the family of my late Chief of Staff, Ken Nyauncho Osinde. May God grant them strength at this painful time. Rest In Peace, Ken," Ruto wrote on his official Twitter account after visiting the family.

The DP confirmed Osinde's death on Friday, November 10, eulogising the deceased ambassador as a leader with robust management skills and a great problem solver.

Fred Matiang'i mourned Osinde

On Sunday, December 12, TUKO.co.ke reported Interior Cabinet Secretary Fred Matiang'i mourned Osinde.

The CS expressed sorrow at the untimely death of his friend, whom he noted exhibited no illness or sickness until his passing on.

"I am utterly confounded and shocked by the news of the sudden death of Ambassador Ken Osinde. For the duration I have known him, Ambassador Osinde has never exhibited sickness or ill health. Indeed, his life has been a portrait of robust health. His devotion to a rigorous personal fitness regime is public knowledge...My heartfelt condolences go to his wife, Judy, his family, friends and the Public Service that has lost. an illustrious administrator," the CS mourned.

Osinde in Makueni

Barely three weeks ago, Osinde represented Ruto at the closing ceremony of the 7th Devolution Conference in Makueni county.

Osinde, however, was turned away by governors who faulted the DP for being disrespectful.

Ruto had been slated to preside over the closing ceremony of the event held in Makueni county on Friday, November 26.

However, the deputy president snubbed the event, instead sending his Chief of Staff, Osinde, to represent him.

headline: Karen Nyamu Responds to Man Who Begged Her for Miraa: "Kujia Wheelbarrow Uwache Kulia"
author: Kai Eli
description: One of Karen Nyamu Facebook followers begged her for money to buy miraa. Instead, she offered him a wheelbarrow. She seeks to become Nairobi senator in 2022.
articleBody:
Karen Nyamu seeks to succeed Johnson Sakaja as the Nairobi senator in the 2022 General Election.

She will be vying for the post through the United Democratic Alliance (UDA) ticket. The outfit is associated with Deputy President William Ruto.

Identified as Dennis Ke, the man wanted to use the money in buying Miraa.

"Karen Nyamu,Youth President leo sina fom sema leo nichane kajaba moja (Karen Nyamu, today I'm not well-off. Kindly help I get some Miraa for today)," said the man as he shared his contact in the anticipation of the politician wiring the funds.

However, the politician turned down the follower's request, offering to empower him with a wheelbarrow instead.

"kujia wheelbarrow uchape shugli upate kakitu uwache kulia (Come for a wheelbarrow you fend for yourself with it. Stop this whining)," she posed.

Ruto endorses Karen Nyamu for Nairobi senatorial post

Nyamu, a lawyer by profession, was officially welcomed to UDA On November 29 by Ruto, who seemed to be endorsing her for the seat.

She was accompanied to Ruto' Keren residency by Law Society of Kenya president Nelson Havi and East African Legislative Assembly MP Simon Mbugua.

"I was honoured to be officially endorsed by the UDA party to contest for senator position in Nairobi county 2022. We fully support William Samoei Ruto's vision to change our economic model in the interest of Kenyans. Mpango ni bottom-up (Bottom-up is the plan)," she said.

The lawyer said he would use the outfit in his bid to succeed Tim Wanyonyi as Westlands MP in 2022.

Nyamu is yet to find a competitor in UDA going for the same seat.

headline: Kenyan SMEs Banking on E-commerce to Grow Businesses - Report
author: Margaret Njugunah
description: Eighty-nine per cent of Kenyan SMEs believe e-commerce will positively impact their businesses, the highest confidence levels in the region, a new research says
articleBody:
A new report by Mastercard has found that 89% of Kenyan SMEs believe in the power of e-commerce, the highest confidence levels on the continent
It also finds that 44% of SMEs in the region recognize faster access to revenue as the most significant benefit of a cashless economy to their business
The technology company also ranked mobile at 59%, online at 49%, and cards at 48% as the most popular digital payment methods used by SMEs

A majority of Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in Kenya believe e-commerce will positively impact their business.

According to a white paper released by technology firm Mastercard, 89% of Kenyan SMEs believe in the power of e-commerce, the highest confidence levels on the continent.

Dubbed ‘The Digital SME: How Are Small and Medium Enterprises in the Middle East and Africa Embracing a Digital Future?’ the paper ranks SMEs in Nigeria second at 73%, followed by SMEs in Ivory Coast at 73%.

Overall, the paper finds that 67% of SMEs in the Middle East and Africa region have faith in the impact of e-commerce in Kenya.

Cashless economy

The report also finds that 44% of SMEs in the region recognize faster access to revenue as the biggest benefit of a cashless economy to their business.

Other benefits identified include the ease of not handling or processing cash at 50% and having more convenient ways of paying suppliers and employees at 50%.

Digital progression

Mastercard notes that the progression rapidly kicked off in 2018, but has witnessed higher traction among larger corporations and financial institutions than among SMEs.

“The acceleration begun in 2020 and 2021, to enable continuity of business, with the data estimating 70% of SMEs globally intensifying their use of digital technologies due to COVID-19 restrictions,” the paper noted.

The technology company also ranked the most popular digital payment methods used by SMEs include mobile at 59%, online at 49%, and cards at 48%.

Digital payments growing

Cellulant Country Manager Faith Nkatha said the company processed $5.7 billion (KSh 640 billion) worth of payments in Kenya in 2019 alone.

Payments further accelerated by 40% in 2020, driven by the COVID- pandemic.

“As more of our merchant customers’ prefer digital payments, we’re innovating new payment frameworks and growing our partnerships in response to this growing demand,” added Nkatha.

“We’re definitely seeing more of our customers from airlines, e-commerce companies, ride-hailing companies, online travel agencies, utilities and telecoms asking for more platform-style digital products and diversity in the payment method they offer to their customers,” she added.

headline: "History tulisoma shuleni": William Ruto, Hustler Brigade Tell Raila, Uhuru
author: Racheal Nyaguthie
description: Led by Nakuru Senator Susan Kihika, the leaders scoffed at Raila's repeated narrations of his importance in Kenya's history and asked him to stop being stuck.
articleBody:
Senator Susan Kihiki told off Raila Odinga for using history to gain political mileage
The vocal senator said while she deeply appreciates history, it was time for the Opposition leader to leave the past
The senator dismissed Raila Odinga's KSh 6,000 stipend to jobless workers and termed it unattainable

A section of Deputy President William Ruto allies has told ODM leader Raila Odinga for using history to gain political mileage instead of selling his agenda to the electorate.

Led by Nakuru Senator Susan Kihika, the leaders scoffed at Raila's repeated narrations of his importance in Kenya's history and asked him to stop being stuck in the past.

Speaking during a meeting at Ruto's Karen residence, the vocal senator said while she deeply appreciates history, it was time for the Opposition leader to leave the past and sell his agenda to the people if he wants to succeed President Uhuru Kenyatta.

Kihika said just Deputy President William Ruto has been selling his agenda to the people in his quest to win the presidency in 2022, Raila should follow suit and tell Kenyans his plans.

At the same time, the senator dismissed Raila Odinga's KSh 6,000 stipend to jobless workers and termed it unattainable.

Raila's pledge

In October this year, Raila pledged KSh 6,000 to every jobless Kenyan through a social welfare state.

He said though his government will focus on the creation of jobs, he will also ensure that every unemployed Kenyan gets a monthly stipend.

"We want every Kenyan to get a job but for those who are unemployed, there will be a social welfare state through which they will get KSh 6,000 monthly stipend," he said.

An insult

Similarly, Deputy President William Ruto had described the former prime minister's KSh 6,000 monthly pledge to every unemployed Kenyan as an 'insult'.

"Anybody telling us the language of government working on a handout programme to give small money to people is an insult to the Kenyan people and the young citizens," he said.

In February, the DP promised to allocate the so-called hustlers KSh 100 million every year if he becomes president in 2022.

headline: Reprieve for Kenyans as EPRA Leaves Fuel Prices Unchanged ahead of Christmas
author: Margaret Njugunah
description: Fuel prices will remain unchanged for one month. A litre of Super petrol will cost KSh 129.72, a litre o diesel KSh 110.60 and a litre of kerosene KSh 103.54.
articleBody:
Kenyans will continue to pay KSh 129.72 for a litre of super petrol, KSh 110.60 for a litre of diesel and KSh 103.54 for a litre of kerosene for the next month
The Energy and Petroleum Regulatory Authority said the new prices are despite an increase in the landed cost of super petrol, diesel, and kerosene
The price retention comes at a time when parliament is trying to bring down the price of fuel

The Energy and Petroleum Regulatory Authority (EPRA) has spared Kenyans from paying more for fuel products as they head for Christmas and New Year festivities.

On Tuesday, December 4, EPRA announced that it had not changed fuel prices, despite rising crude oil costs.

As a result, Nairobi residents will continue to pay KSh 129.72 for a litre of super petrol, KSh 110.60 for a litre of diesel and KSh 103.54 for a litre of kerosene.

Mombasa residents will continue to pay KSh 127.46 for a litre of super petrol, KSh 108.36 for a litre of diesel and KSh 101.29 for a litre of kerosene.

In Nakuru, residents will pay KSh 129.24 for super petrol, KSh 110.43 for a litre of diesel and KSh 103.39 for a litre of kerosene.

Eldoret residents will spend KSh 130.13 for a litre of super petrol, KSh 111.32 for a litre of diesel and KSh 104.27 for a litre of kerosene.

Meanwhile, Kisumu residents will pay KSh 130.12 for super petrol, KSh 111.30 for a litre of diesel and KSh 104.26 for a litre of kerosene.

Cushioning Kenyans

EPRA said the new prices are despite an increase in the landed cost of super petrol diesel and kerosene.

“Despite the increase in the landed costs, the applicable pump prices for this cycle have been maintained as the ones applicable in the previous cycle,” EPRA’s Director-General Daniel Kiptoo Bargoria said in a statement.

He added that the government would utilize the Petroleum Development Levy to cushion consumers from the otherwise high prices.

Government intervention

The price retention comes when parliament is trying to bring down the price of fuel.

TUKO.co.ke reported that MPs had proposed to have the commodity prices reduced by KSh 10.49 per litre, allowing Kenyans to pay a flat rate of KSh 124.23 for a litre of super petrol.

They also recommended that the costs of diesel and kerosene come down to KSh 105.82 and KSh 103.71 per litre, respectively, from the current KSh 115.60 and KSh 110.82.

  • The Energy and Petroleum Regulatory Authority said the new prices are despite an increase in the landed cost of super petrol, diesel, and kerosene
  • The price retention comes at a time when parliament is trying to bring down the price of fuel

The Energy and Petroleum Regulatory Authority (EPRA) has spared Kenyans from paying more for fuel products as they head for Christmas and New Year festivities.

On Tuesday, December 4, EPRA announced that it had not changed fuel prices, despite rising crude oil costs.

As a result, Nairobi residents will continue to pay KSh 129.72 for a litre of super petrol, KSh 110.60 for a litre of diesel and KSh 103.54 for a litre of kerosene.

Mombasa residents will continue to pay KSh 127.46 for a litre of super petrol, KSh 108.36 for a litre of diesel and KSh 101.29 for a litre of kerosene.

In Nakuru, residents will pay KSh 129.24 for super petrol, KSh 110.43 for a litre of diesel and KSh 103.39 for a litre of kerosene.

Eldoret residents will spend KSh 130.13 for a litre of super petrol, KSh 111.32 for a litre of diesel and KSh 104.27 for a litre of kerosene.

Meanwhile, Kisumu residents will pay KSh 130.12 for super petrol, KSh 111.30 for a litre of diesel and KSh 104.26 for a litre of kerosene.

Cushioning Kenyans

EPRA said the new prices are despite an increase in the landed cost of super petrol diesel and kerosene.

“Despite the increase in the landed costs, the applicable pump prices for this cycle have been maintained as the ones applicable in the previous cycle,” EPRA’s Director-General Daniel Kiptoo Bargoria said in a statement.

He added that the government would utilize the Petroleum Development Levy to cushion consumers from the otherwise high prices.

Government intervention

The price retention comes when parliament is trying to bring down the price of fuel.

TUKO.co.ke reported that MPs had proposed to have the commodity prices reduced by KSh 10.49 per litre, allowing Kenyans to pay a flat rate of KSh 124.23 for a litre of super petrol.

They also recommended that the costs of diesel and kerosene come down to KSh 105.82 and KSh 103.71 per litre, respectively, from the current KSh 115.60 and KSh 110.82.

headline: Ferdinand Waititu Says He's the Top Contender for Kiambu Gubernatorial Seat
author: Kai Eli
description: Former Kiambu governor Ferdinand Waititu has dismissed his competitors in the Kiambu gubernatorial race next year. He said he's certain he'll be re-elected.
articleBody:
Ex-Kiambu governor Ferdinand Waititu has expressed bis confidence in being re-elected governor during the 2022 General Election
Waititu said the electorate in Kiambu is aware of his works and the vision he had for the county before his impeachment
Waititu lost his seat in late 2019 after the county assembly successfully ousted him over abuse of office; The Senate upheld the ouster in January 2020

Former Kiambu governor Ferdinand Waititu is upbeat about winning the Kiambu gubernatorial race in 2022.

Waititu said he had edged over the other competitors in the race.

He said he is confident that the electorate in Kiambu county will re-elect him due to his record and the vision he had for the county before his impeachment in 2019.

"Tigoni and Thika Level Five among other hospitals were stalled before I took over. They are now complete. I have not even mentioned the many markets that were almost complete before I was dethroned," he said.

Waititu lost his seat in late 2019 after the Kiambu county assembly successfully ousted him on the basis of abuse of office and gross violation of the constitution.

His impeachment was upheld by the Senate plenary in January 2020.

The former county boss, who is currently in Deputy President William Ruto's camp, will be facing off with Thika MP Patrick Wainaina, who also eyes the governorship via the United Democratic Alliance (UDA) party ticket.

Further, the politician, who was at one point linked to KANU, stated that he is in the Ruto-led camp by choice.

He said he chose to join KANU out of fear that the state would revive more graft charges against him.

"They wanted to add me another case and that is how I changed my political affiliation for protection. I was actually advised to do so by some investigators and EACC officers," he said.

"I'm in UDA by choice and even when I was in KANU, my heart was still in UDA," added Waititu.

headline: Gadget Sales in Kenya Grow by 25% in 2021 Supported by Pandemic Measures
author: Margaret Njugunah
description: Salute Holdings data shows that the sale of high-end gadget sales in Kenya grew by 25% in 2021, driven by the need for more IT solutions amid ongoing pandemic.
articleBody:
The sale of high-end gadgets grew by 25% in 2021 as people sought more IT solutions amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic
Tablet sales registered the highest increase, followed by laptops as the government urged citizens to stay at home to avoid further spread of COVID-19
Kenya’s Information Technology (IT) market was valued at KSh 71.7 billion at the end of 2020, with computer hardware sales totalling KSh 40.7 billion

Kenyans continued to buy high-end gadgets this year, with data showing that sales of the devices grew by 25% in 2021 compared to 2020.

A finding by Salute iWorld revealed that tablets were the most popular of the bunch, registering the highest increase during the period.

Laptops followed closely, supported by work from home orders initiated by the Ministry of Health to curb the spread of COVID-19.

Expanding middle class

The company also said it anticipates demand for high-end gadgets to grow due to the expanding middle class and growth of remote working.

“Some companies might allow every employee the flexibility to work on-site and remotely part of the week. Other companies might have employees working either full-time remote or full-time on-site. And others might allow a combo of the two,” said Michelle Abuya, Senior Business Manager, Salute Holdings Group.

Tanzania.

Booming IT sector

The data by Salute Holdings comes at the back of a finding by the International Trade Administration, which revealed that Kenya’s Information Technology (IT) market was valued at $635 million (KSh 71.7 billion) at the end of 2020, with computer hardware sales totalling $360 million (KSh 40.7 billion).

The report also reveals that the value of IT software sales was US$ 174 million (KSh 19.6 billion) and the balance on other services.

Telecommunications and broadcast equipment also grew by 6% at the end of the year.

“Kenya is at the forefront of technological innovations in the region and is often referred to as Africa’s ‘Silicon Savannah.’ The Government of Kenya (GOK) has invested heavily in the ICT sector and has recognized the sector as a key contributor to the country’s GDP,” the Ministry of Trade said.

Slow down

Data by Gartner, Inc however reveal that worldwide PC shipments totalled 84.1 million units in the third quarter of 2021.

The report noted that as the vaccines for COVID-19 becomes more widely available, consumer and educational spending shifted away from PCs to other priorities, slowing momentum gained.

headline: Uhuru Kenyatta, Other Prominent Kenyans Spotted with Most Expensive Wrist Watches
author: Japhet Ruto
description: Uhuru Kenyatta, William Ruto and COTU secretary-general Francis Atwoli are some of the prominent Kenyans who have been spotted with most expensive watches.
articleBody:
A joint report released by Knight Frank-Stanbic Bank in 2020 showed Kenya has over 3,200 people worth $1 million (KSh 112 million) and above
Rolex, Audemars Piguet and Patek Philippe are some of the top brands owned by people with resources
Some of the popular Kenyans who own a collection of expensive wristwatches are President Uhuru Kenyatta, Deputy President William Ruto and COTU secretary-general Francis Atwoli

Despite the need for watches waning in the era of smartphones, prominent Kenyans have been spotted wearing expensive gold-themed wrist timepieces.

A joint report released by Knight Frank-Stanbic Bank in 2020 showed Kenya has over 3,200 people worth $1 million (KSh 112 million) and above.

A report by the Guardian stated that Rolex, Audemars Piguet and Patek Philippe are some of the top brands owned by people with resources.

Some of the popular Kenyans who own a collection of expensive wristwatches are President Uhuru Kenyatta, Deputy President William Ruto, COTU secretary-general Francis Atwoli and Mombasa governor Hassan Joho.

1. Uhuru Kenyatta

President Uhuru Kenyatta often steps out with a wristwatch during public occasions.

The head of state has a taste for quality watches and has a collection worth over KSh 40 million.

Platinum with dial-in Black model watch

During the 2019 Mashujaa Day celebrations at Mama Ngina Waterfront Park in Mombasa, Uhuru rocked the KSh 34 million watch, Classic 105 reported.

Audemars Piguet Royal Oak

This one costs a whopping KSh 3.8 million.

Santos 100 carbon watch

Family Basilica in Nairobi.

The item cost him KSh 782,000 according to The Standard.

The president parted with KSh 3.3 million to acquire it.

Deputy President William Ruto has in the recent few years described himself as the son of a peasant who rose from humble beginnings as a chicken seller to occupy the second-highest office in the land.

According to Pulselive, the DP was spotted with a Hublot Big Bang gold watch that cost him KSh 2.6 million.

To match his trendy outfits, the 45-year-old puts on gold-themed wristwatches.

In 2017, TUKO.co.ke reported he was spotted with a Hublot Bigbang Rosegold valued at a mind-boggling KSh 2.1 million.

Some outlets sell the watch for a whopping KSh 2.6 million, the price of a new Toyota Corolla 2017 model.

KTN, Atwoli said he dons attire worth KSh 1 million daily.

During the same JKL show, he revealed he wears a watch worth KSh 5 million.

"I am a designer's guy. Even my gold watch is KSh 5 million. If you are found with this watch, you will be arrested," he bragged.

5. Jalang'o

In July, comedian Jalang'o told TUKO.co.ke that celebrated journalist Jeff Koinange bought him a KSh 3 million watch during his birthday.

headline: African CEOs Optimistic About Economic Growth Driven by Increase in Intra-African Trade
author: Margaret Njugunah
description: African CEOs are optimistic about their business and economic growth for the next 12 to 18 months, driven by a positive economic outlook on their industries.
articleBody:
African CEOs say they are optimistic about business and economic growth in the next 12 to 18 months
The leaders believe more in international and regional trade strategies and agreements such as the enhancement of trading opportunities than in national economic recovery strategies
Low access to finance was singled out as the most significant challenge the CEOs foresee, followed by the ongoing impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on economic opportunities

Business leaders in Africa are confident about business and economic growth in the next 12 to 18 months, driven by optimism about the economic outlook of their industry.

In a survey conducted on the continent, 87% of respondents believe there will be an increase in intra-African trade due to the African Continental Free Trade Agreement (AfCFTA).

The survey was administered to CEOs from 46 countries and conducted by the Pan-African Private Sector Trade and Investment Committee.

The business leaders believe that the global recovery led by greater demand will drive Africa's economic recovery.

The CEOs are also believe more in international and regional trade strategies and agreements, such as enhancing trading opportunities, than in national economic recovery strategies.

Faith in the trade agreement

According to the report, over 71% of respondents believe that the AfCFTA will encourage them to invest in growing their business regionally.

More than half of respondents at 57% also believe that the AfCFTA will open up new markets to export regionally and provide the necessary frameworks to export more regionally 62%.

The four top export destinations in Africa are South Africa 27%, Ghana 25%, Kenya 25% and Nigeria 19%.

Challenges

The CEOs said the key challenges they foresee, which will hurt Africa's economic recovery prospects, are a lack of access to finance 64%, the ongoing impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on economic opportunities 61% and a slow down or lack of public sector investment and expenditure 48%.

The survey's findings come even as a study by United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) revealed that the trade agreement could boost maritime trade on the continent.

The UN agency revealed that the agreement could increase demand for different modes of transport, including maritime transport, which in turn will increase investment requirements for infrastructure and equipment, namely ports and vessels in the case of maritime transport.

In a related story, TUKO.co.ke business activity in the first quarter of 2022 to mirror the fourth quarter of 2021.

A survey conducted by the Central Bank of Kenya reveals that businesses anticipate that the continued resumption of normal operations will support business activity in the first quarter of 2022.

According to the Monetary Policy committee CEOs survey November 2021, the services sector, particularly, expects strong performance.

Firms in professional services anticipate a significant increase in business activity in the first quarter of 2022, dependent on seasonal factors.

At the same time, respondents in the agricultural sector foresee global economic recovery supporting demand and sales volumes.

headline: List of Highest-Paid Radio Presenters in Kenya and Their Salaries
author: Japhet Ruto
description: Kenya has over 900 radio stations. Most of the stations are based in the capital, Nairobi. Jeff Koinange, Churchill and Gidi Gidi are some of the highest paid.
articleBody:
As of 2020, Kenya had 908 radio FM frequencies after a marginal drop from 918 in the previous year
The Communications of Authority of Kenya Audience Measurement and Industry Trends Report for Q2 2019-2020 showed Citizen Radio commands the highest listeners at 12%
Citizen Radio was followed by Radio Jambo (6.5%), Radio Maisha (5.9%) and Inooro FM (3.3%)
Seasoned journalist Jeff Koinange who doubles up as a radio presenter at Hot 96 and news anchor at Citizen TV takes home approximately KSh 2 million monthly

As of 2020, Kenya had 908 radio FM frequencies, according to the 2021 Economic Survey.

The report showed the number of radio FM frequencies declined by nine from 918 in 2019.

The Communications of Authority of Kenya Audience Measurement and Industry Trends Report for Q2 2019-2020 showed Citizen Radio commands the highest listeners at 12%.

It was followed by Radio Jambo (6.5%), Radio Maisha (5.9%) and Inooro FM (3.3%).

The highest-paid radio presenters in Kenya take home millions of shillings monthly.

Who are the highest-paid radio presenters in Kenya?

1. Jeff Koinange

In April, celebrated journalist Jeff Koinange marked his fourth anniversary as a radio presenter at Hot 96, one of the stations under Royal Media Services.

2. Maina Kageni

Maina Kageni, born on June 29, 1974, is a breakfast show presenter at Classic FM run by Radio Africa Group.

Maina earns KSh 2 million monthly, exclusive of bonuses.

He co-hosts alongside comedian Churchill (Mwalimu King'angi).

3. Joseph Oyoo (Gidi Gidi)

Joseph Oyoo popularly referred to as Gidi Gidi is a radio presenter at Radio Jambo.

The former musician who switched his focus to journalism has been cracking ribs alongside Jacob 'Ghost' Mulee where they host the morning breakfast show featuring 'Patanisho'.

Gidi says Patanisho is a free and fun icebreaker show with light moments which involve making partners reunite.

He reportedly earns KSh 2 million.

4. Churchill (Daniel Ndambuki)

Churchill is regarded as the father of the comedy industry in Kenya. He runs the multimillion Laugh Industry.

Eric Omondi and Chipukeezy.

He also co-presents the morning radio show at Classic 105 with Maina Kageni, where he earns slightly over KSh 1 million monthly.

His wide recognition as a comedian started heightening in the all-time hit comedy show 'Redykyulass', popular during the late Daniel arap Moi regime.

5. Daniel Githinji Mwangi (Mbusi)

Daniel Githinji Mwangi popularly known as Mbusii made the big switch from Ghetto Radio to Radio Jambo in 2013.

He co-presents the Mbusii Na Lion Teke Teke show alongside Liondee from 3pm to 7pm.

In a previous interview, he revealed he earns close to KSh 700,000.

6. Jacob 'Ghost' Mulee

Jacob 'Ghost' Mulee is a Radio Jambo breakfast show co-host.

Mulee was the immediate Harambee Stars coach.

His salary is around KSh 600,000.
